metadata.title: CVE-2024-47668 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:lib/generic-radix-tree.c: Fix rare race in __genradix_ptr_alloc()If we need to increase the tree depth, allocate a new node, and thenrace with another thread that increased the tree depth before us, we'llstill have a preallocated node that might be used later.If we then use that node for a new non-root node, it'll still have apointer to the old root instead of being zeroed - fix this by zeroing itin the cmpxchg failure path.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-50.51').
